title: 🤔 Each pumpkin is 75 cents per pound, If I purchase 3 pumpkin, EXAMPLE: :: 1 big pumpkin🎃, and 2 small pumpkin🔸🔸how much will it cost me 💵? - Quora

response.answer_text: Weigh all three pumpkins together. Size of each one does not matter. If you want to find out how much each one is, weigh each one separately. Will you have to pay for an entire extra pound if the weight is a little over an even pound? You should ask that question.

It all depends on the weight of the pumpkins. The size can be anywhere from the size of a basketball to two or three times as large for 1 big pumpkin and baseball size to basketball or bowling ball size for a small one. We can only guess at the weights and cost.

Patrick, it all depends on the weight of those three pumpkins. All you alluded to was the cost per pound = 75 cents. You spoke of one large and two small pumpkins. Fine, but you must think we are gods to know what actually are the weights of those pumpkins. Sorry, just had to add my comments and hope others will be able to respond to your question.

🤔 Each pumpkin is 75 cents per pound, If I purchase 3 pumpkin, EXAMPLE: :: 1 big pumpkin🎃, and 2 small pumpkin🔸🔸how much will it cost me 💵? It will cost you the combined weight (in pounds) of the three pumpkins times 0.75 (in dollars). Not knowing the weight, that’s the best I can do.
It depends on how much they each weigh. There’s no information about how much they weigh, so there’s no way to calculate the cost, since it is expressed as 75 cents per pound.
